item.title: The World Bank has released its 2017 forecast for the Thai economy
item.description:
The 2016 Thailand Economic Monitor, published today by the World Bank, projects Thailand’s economic growth to reach 3.1% in 2016 and 3.2% in 2017, surpassing the previous year’s 2.8%. The report identifies private consumption and public investments, such as rail infrastructure projects, as primary growth drivers. Tourism has also performed well in 2016, with tourist arrivals, particularly from China, rising by 13.1% in the third quarter. A temporary slowdown and economic inactivity following the passing of HM King Bhumibol Adulyadej in October are anticipated to be partially counterbalanced by year-end holiday tax incentives for shopping and domestic tourism...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-world-bank-has-released-its-2017-forecast-for-the-thai-economy/

item.title: The Dubai Chamber has announced the launch of the Dubai Smartpreneur Competition for 2017
item.description:
The Dubai Chamber of Commerce and Industry, working with the Smart Dubai Office, launched the second annual Dubai Smartpreneur Competition. This aligns with the vision of His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, UAE Vice President and Prime Minister, and Ruler of Dubai, to make Dubai a leading smart city. Source: Dubai Chamber. The event featured a panel discussion about the UAE government’s progress on smart city and innovation initiatives, and what will drive future sustainable growth...

item.title: SIM Global Education hosts information sessions on smart city design
item.description:
SIM Global Education (SIM GE) is hosting informational meetings with industry experts for individuals interested in their Master in Design for Smart Cities program in Singapore, a collaborative offering with the Strate School of Design from France. A series of online discussions will be held featuring: urban planning expert Yann Follain on October 2nd, Airbus’s Cyrille Schwob on October 24th, sustainable smart cities specialist Pablo Viejo on October 28th, and PSA Peugeot Citroen’s Gregory Blokkeel, focusing on smart city mobility, on November 8th...

Pictured showing support for the 99% SME Shopping Week 2017 are (from left): Ted Tan, Deputy Chief Executive of SPRING Singapore; Yeo Hiang Meng, President of the Federation of Merchants’ Association of Singapore; Joyce Tee, Managing Director and Group Head of SME Banking at DBS Bank; Sim Ann, Senior Minister of State for the Ministry of Trade and Industry and Ministry of Culture, Community and Youth; Andrew Lim, Managing Director of Business Group, Group Enterprise at Singtel; and Parminder Singh, Chief Commercial and Digital Officer of Mediacorp...

item.title: In 2017, a settlement network powered by blockchain announced that it would waive fees for transfers to Singapore
item.description:
OKLink, a global settlement platform, has introduced the first entirely free remittance corridor. The company stated that transfers up to US$100,000 each month to Singapore will be free throughout 2017. Previously, OKLink applied a 0.1% fee on cross-border payments to Singapore, while other companies might charge up to US$5 per transaction. “As the world’s largest blockchain-powered global settlement network, we can process cross-border payments faster and more affordably as more partners join,” explained Jack Liu, Chief Strategy Officer at OKLink...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/in-2017-a-settlement-network-powered-by-blockchain-announced-that-it-would-waive-fees-for-transfers-to-singapore/

item.title: The Al Ain Cultural Programme for 2017/2018 is currently in full swing
item.description:
The Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi recently held three events showcasing Emirati culture and heritage as part of the annual Al Ain Cultural Programme. On October 19th, Qasr Al Muwaiji (Al Muwaiji Palace) hosted the Bisht Workshop, which delved into the history of the traditional garment worn by UAE rulers and the unique patterns associated with each ruler. Attendees also participated in a hands-on workshop, learning to create their own bisht...

item.description:

The mooncakes are available in a variety of flavors like cookies ’n cream surprise, durian royale, Rocher crunch, and sticky chewy chocolate. Source: Swensen’s website. Four chocolate-covered flavours are on offer in Swensen’s mooncake collection for 2017. Place your order to take advantage of the 20% early bird discount available to Swensen’s Cool Rewards and Kids’ Club members...

item.title: Emojis are sweeping the world by storm 🌩
item.description:
On July 17, in honor of World Emoji Day, App Annie wanted to learn more about the world’s love for emojis. They teamed up with Leanplum to publish a report called “Winning App ❤ (& 💸 ) With Emojis” which explores mobile marketing trends. The report highlights some interesting findings, including the fact that the word “emoji” is now officially in the Oxford Dictionary. Additionally: The use of emojis grew significantly in 2016, increasing by 163%, and the range of emojis used by marketers also expanded by 10%...

item.title: Zhaopin reveals changes in the entry-level job market in China
item.description:
Zhaopin, a Chinese career platform that connects users with job opportunities, conducted a 2017 career survey of college graduates in China, revealing notable trends. The survey indicated that graduates faced a more challenging job market and lower average salaries, presenting a difficult situation for the 7.95 million graduates entering the workforce. 2017 Labor Market for College Graduates Difficult and very challenging: 40.8% Difficult, but acceptable: 47.0% The market was OK: 9...

item.title: Aon announces the recipients of the Aon Best Employers Singapore 2017 award
item.description:
Employee engagement at companies recognized as Aon Best Employers rose by two percentage points this year, reaching 82%. Aon Best Employers are setting the standard for positive employer branding, achieving scores from 83% to 92% in employee perception across all levels of tenure. item.description:

Gift Something, a Hong Kong-based online retailer specializing in premium gifts, conducted a survey to understand the practice of giving red envelopes (known as angpow or red packets in Singapore, and lai see or red pockets in Hong Kong) during Chinese New Year. Traditionally, married couples give these envelopes to unmarried individuals during the first 15 days of the Lunar New Year to bring luck...

item.description:
The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) announced new initiatives during the opening ceremony of Singapore Green Building Week (SGBW). These initiatives, stemming from a review of the third Green Building Masterplan, focus on improving occupant indoor environmental quality, promoting energy-efficient buildings, and incorporating green practices into existing structures. Desmond Lee, Singapore’s Minister for Social and Family Development and Second Minister for National Development, was the guest of honor at the ceremony...

item.title: The Philippines' economic outlook has improved according to the World Bank
item.description:
The World Bank has improved its economic forecast for the Philippines from 2016 to 2018. They now predict the Philippine economy will grow by 6.8% in 2016, up from their previous prediction of 6.4% made in October (World Bank Philippines Economic Update October 2016). This adjustment is based on stronger than expected growth in the third quarter of 2016, fueled by increased investment and private consumption. This follows robust economic performance in the first half of 2016, driven by the government’s pre-election spending...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-philippines-economic-outlook-has-improved-according-to-the-world-bank/

item.title: The first Founders' Friday session in Singapore by Huawei will showcase Scott Bales
item.description:
Source: Scott Bales website. Huawei is launching a new networking series called Founders’ Friday. The series aims to connect business leaders with professionals to exchange ideas, address difficulties, and develop innovative solutions for advancing the digital world. The inaugural event, presented alongside the HUAWEI Mate 9, features prominent digital and innovation expert Scott Bales. He will discuss essential principles for fostering a culture of innovation within organizations. Bales, the Managing Director of Singapore-based Innovation Labs Asia, brings over a decade of global experience in innovation, thought leadership, implementation planning, and strategy...

item.title: The IPO activity in Singapore is expected to exceed that of 2016 in 2017
item.description:
During the first half of 2017, Singapore saw a surge in initial public offerings (IPOs), attracting US$329 million in investments, as reported by PwC Singapore. This momentum is projected to continue, potentially exceeding the total funds raised in 2016. Professional services are emerging as a leading sector, with HRnetGroup and Shopper360’s IPOs securing a combined US$134 million, a significant leap from the previous year. While Real Estate Investment Trusts (REITs) and business trusts, a traditional strength for the Singapore Exchange (SGX), constituted 33% of IPO proceeds, the anticipated listing of NetLink Trust, estimated at US$1...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-ipo-activity-in-singapore-is-expected-to-exceed-that-of-2016-in-2017/

item.title: The True Colours Festival showcases performances by exceptionally talented artists with disabilities
item.description:
The True Colours Festival, showcasing talented performing artists with disabilities from the Asia Pacific region, will run from March 22nd to 25th, 2018 in Singapore. The festival will feature up to 20 artist/troupe performances representing Japan, China, India, Korea, Malaysia, Cambodia, Kazakhstan, New Zealand, Australia, and Singapore. Guest artists from the UK and Canada will also be featured. Performances will take place at a multimedia concert experience inside the Singapore Indoor Stadium and at the nearby True Colours Festival Village...

item.title: Business sentiment in Singapore for 2017 is characterized by caution
item.description:
The Singapore government has released business sentiment data for 2017, covering both the manufacturing and retail sectors. In the manufacturing sector, a survey conducted by the Singapore Economic Development Board revealed that a weighted 76% of firms expect business conditions in the first half of 2017 to remain similar to the previous quarter. While 13% anticipate improvement, 11% foresee a decline. Overall, the net weighted balance sits at 2%, indicating a slightly positive outlook for the manufacturing sector in early 2017...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/business-sentiment-in-singapore-for-2017-is-characterized-by-caution/

item.title: Jane's Walk is back in Singapore for its fifth year
item.description:
Source: Jane’s Walk Singapore Peatix website. Aerial view of Queenstown. Now in its fifth year, Jane’s Walk Singapore is hosting a weekend of free walking tours throughout the city. Inspired by urbanist, author, and activist Jane Jacobs, Jane’s Walk is a series of free, volunteer-led walking tours. Jacobs advocated for walkable, lively neighborhoods and encouraged community involvement in urban development. Her most renowned work, The Death and Life of Great American Cities, emphasizes the importance of observation, inquiry, and exploration in understanding cities...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/jane-s-walk-is-back-in-singapore-for-its-fifth-year/

item.title: JeweLuxe Singapore introduces a unique luxury retail concept unlike any other
item.description:
JeweLuxe Singapore, a curated showcase featuring design, craft, artistry, and innovation from around the world, will launch in Singapore this October at TENT@Ngee Ann City along Orchard Road. The exhibition, open to the public from October 6 to 15, 2017, will showcase items for collectors, connoisseurs, and enthusiasts across various luxury lifestyle segments, including jewelry, timepieces, vintage items, eyewear, fashion, art, and living. Supported by the Singapore Tourism Board’s Kickstart Fund, this first-of-its-kind exhibition combines offline and online concepts, featuring aspects of a retail exhibition and an e-commerce marketplace...

item.title: Australia has a high usage of digital payment methods
item.description:
A recent Mastercard study shows Australians are steadily adopting digital payment methods, with over 80% using contactless payments weekly. In fact, a significant number of Australians get frustrated when stores don’t offer contactless payment options, and some even choose to shop elsewhere in such situations. Supermarkets, retail stores, and gas stations are where Australians most frequently use contactless cards. Garry Duursma, Mastercard Australia and New Zealand’s Head of Market Development and Payment Innovation, points out that Australians find contactless payments convenient and efficient...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/australia-has-a-high-usage-of-digital-payment-methods/

item.title: The IMF has finished its 2017 Article IV consultation with Vietnam
item.description:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) recently finished its regular economic review of Vietnam, finding that the country’s economy remains in good shape, supported by strong underlying economic conditions. Despite a slowdown in 2016 to 6.2% growth due to agricultural challenges from drought and saltwater intrusion, as well as reduced oil production, Vietnam’s economy has shown resilience. While the oil sector continued to struggle in early 2017, strong manufacturing and foreign direct investment, healthy domestic demand, and a resurgence in agriculture are driving overall economic momentum...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-imf-has-finished-its-2017-article-iv-consultation-with-vietnam/

The videos are in English and include traditional Chinese subtitles. The year of the fire rooster starts on January 28, 2017. Yap considers the rooster one of the luckiest animals in 2017...

item.description:

Taking place at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibition Centre (ADNEC) from October 14th to 17th, 2017, the event will host over 3,000 participants and experts representing approximately 75 countries. item.title: If you have digital or tech skills, chances are your salary is above average
item.description:
Source: Willis Towers Watson. Report cover. The financial sector, particularly in digital roles, is experiencing salary stability due to a high demand for tech professionals. This trend persists despite overall economic weakness in other industries, including banking, according to the global advisory firm Willis Towers Watson. Businesses across all sectors are becoming progressively reliant on data and technology, and the banking industry is no exception. This shift has resulted in a talent competition where technological expertise is more valuable than financial background...

item.title: The Durian Fiesta 2017 has been announced by Goodwood Park Hotel
item.description:
Goodwood Park Hotel is hosting its yearly Durian Fiesta, featuring new creations and beloved classics that have delighted guests since 1983. From March 10th to July 31st, 2017, fourteen premium durian desserts, including six new additions, will be available, all crafted using the finest D24 and Mao Shan Wang durians. The featured desserts include the new D24 Starry Starry Night Ice Cream Cake, the D24 Sunflower Seed Crumble Tartlet, the D24 Cashew Nut Crumble Tartlet, the D24 Matcha Cake, and the D24 Salted Caramel Cuppa...

item.title: In Asia, cards account for 52% of payments, but there are new emerging payment tools
item.description:
A study by ACI Worldwide and Ovum, “2017 Global Payments Insight Survey: Merchants and Retailers,” found that 79% of merchants and retailers believe a comprehensive approach to payments across different channels is crucial for a positive customer experience. The study showed that while the EMV chip card standard has reduced in-person fraud, online fraud is on the rise. Merchants and retailers are planning to significantly increase their investments in payments to improve customer experience (a 50% increase compared to 2015)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/in-asia-cards-account-for-52-of-payments-but-there-are-new-emerging-payment-tools/

item.title: Experience cutting-edge VR gaming at Bugis Junction and Bugis+, Singapore
item.description:
This Halloween, shoppers at Singapore’s Bugis Junction and Bugis+ malls can participate in an immersive virtual reality (VR) gaming experience. This event marks the first time malls in Singapore have hosted a VR experience of this magnitude. The “Time Zombies” competition invites shoppers to assume the roles of time-traveling detectives. Their mission: to stop the nefarious Dr. Virago, a mad scientist attempting to unleash a zombie apocalypse. This competition utilizes cutting-edge Arctic Fox wireless technology, allowing players to move freely within the virtual world using a wireless headset, eliminating the need for cumbersome cables or backpack computers...

Avaya, a telecommunications company, recently released the results of their first annual Hospitality Industry Survey. item.description:

item.title: Investment commitments in Singapore remain in a positive trend
item.description:
Global companies continued to view Singapore as a crucial base in Asia for expansion and innovation in 2016, with investment commitments meeting or exceeding the Economic Development Board (EDB)’s projections. The EDB remains committed to pursuing opportunities in thriving sectors to foster sustained economic growth and create quality employment prospects for Singaporeans. Attracting S$9.4 billion in fixed asset investments, Singapore exceeded its forecast of S$8 billion to S$10 billion. Total business expenditure reached S$8...

item.title: AccorHotels will be introducing a Gourmet Food & Wine Festival in Singapore in the coming year
item.description:
Source: AccorHotels. Jaan was awarded a Michelin Star in the Singapore Michelin Guide 2016 and secured the 29th spot in Asia’s 50 Best Restaurants 2016. AccorHotels, the leading hotel operator in the country, is launching its first-ever Gourmet Food & Wine Festival, anticipated to be one of the most extensive events of its kind in Singapore. The festival will feature several Michelin-starred chefs. Graham Wilson, Chief Marketing & Distribution Officer for AccorHotels Asia Pacific, stated, “In a city celebrated for its culinary scene, AccorHotels will bring together some of our finest chefs from around the world and showcase the immense talent of Singaporean chefs to create a food festival as lively and diverse as Singapore itself...

item.title: The IMF predicts a positive outcome for Pakistan's economic growth
item.description:
The IMF Executive Board finalized its regular economic assessment of Pakistan on June 14, 2017. The IMF determined that Pakistan’s economic outlook is positive, with real GDP expected to reach 5.3% in FY2016/17 and rise to 6% in the medium term. This growth is attributed to increased investments from the China Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), greater energy availability, and structural reforms that support economic expansion. While inflation has gradually risen, the IMF team stated it remains manageable, and the financial sector is stable...

item.title: Robert Half suggests diversifying incentives in order to retain talent
item.description:
A significant portion of Singapore’s workforce prioritizes work-life balance over higher salaries, according to a recent study. The Robert Half 2017 Salary Guide highlights that 69% of Singaporean employees are driven by more than just monetary compensation. The study reveals that nearly half (43%) would accept lower pay for flexible work hours, while over a third (37%) would choose the ability to work remotely over a pay raise. Non-financial benefits are highly valued by Singaporean workers, with 28% willing to trade a portion of their salary for increased medical benefits and 20% favoring more vacation time...

item.title: Singapore companies are considering hiring senior technology professionals to address the shortage of talent
item.description:
Despite job market growth, a 2017 survey by the Singapore Infocomm Technology Federation (SiTF) reveals that the infocommunications (ICM) industry struggles to find talent with the right IT and business skills. The survey of 181 companies found that 75% consider recruiting suitable talent their biggest challenge. This problem particularly affects startups (91%), followed by small and medium enterprises (SMEs) at 76% and multinational corporations (MNCs) at 75%. Source: SITF. The talent situation in Singapore for ICM...

item.title: Saudi Arabia has announced the release of its 2017 budget
item.description:
Saudi Arabia’s King Salman bin Abdulaziz recently announced the nation’s budget for 2017. The budget is set at SAR890 billion, representing an 8% rise from the previous year. It is anticipated to significantly reduce the kingdom’s deficit by a historic 33%. King Salman emphasized the strength and resilience of the Saudi economy, stating, “Our economy is firm and it has sufficient strength to cope with the current economic and financial challenges...

item.description:

Here are a few ideas: Facials Kew Organics’ Red Carpet Organic Facial presents a natural, non-surgical method for achieving a more youthful appearance. This facial utilizes non-invasive skin-firming methods to deliver a lifted, firmer, and more radiant look. item.title: Passenger figures for Dubai taxis in the first quarter of 2017 have been released
item.description:
Source: RTA. A taxi on Dubai roads. During the first quarter of 2017, taxis in Dubai, UAE provided 25,795,251 rides, serving a total of 44,883,737 passengers. Dubai’s taxi franchises collectively operate 10,038 vehicles. Here’s a breakdown by company: Dubai Taxi: 12,981,104 trips, serving 21,050,701 passengers. Arabia Taxi: 2,536,705 trips, serving 4,413,867 passengers. Cars Taxi: 5,311,065 trips, serving 9,241,253 passengers. Metro Taxi: 1,995,090 trips, serving 3,471,457 passengers. National Taxi: 3,755,367 trips, serving 6,534,339 passengers...

item.title: Businesses operating in the South China Sea region should be cautious of the Spring Dragon APT
item.description:
Kaspersky Lab is issuing a warning about a threat actor targeting nations surrounding the South China Sea. The cybersecurity company has observed a rise in attacks since 2017 from an advanced persistent threat (APT) known as Spring Dragon (or LotusBlossom) using new and enhanced tactics. Noushin Shabab, Senior Security Researcher at Kaspersky Lab’s Global Research & Analysis Team (GReAT), emphasizes the importance of vigilance, stating, “We believe Spring Dragon will continue to reappear in the Asian region, making it crucial to be familiar with its methods...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/businesses-operating-in-the-south-china-sea-region-should-be-cautious-of-the-spring-dragon-apt/

item.title: Goodwood Park Hotel is ringing in the Lunar New Year with a wide array of delicious treats
item.description:
Goodwood Park Hotel is celebrating the arrival of spring and Lunar New Year with a variety of festive treats, including yu sheng platters and savory specials, with a focus on the pineapple, a symbol of fortune. Among the delicious takeaway options are the Duo of Prosperity Fish, featuring mango with pomelo and sago, and durian pudding. The hotel’s pastry team has also created an impressive Auspicious Golden Pineapple vanilla pound cake and a large Huat!..

item.title: Experience an unexpected Christmas at Goodwood Park Hotel
item.description:
Goodwood Park Hotel in Singapore has designed a Christmas menu featuring new versions of classic dishes, playful food presentations, and delightful surprises. These festive meals and unique takeaway options aim to make holiday celebrations even more memorable. This year’s new gourmet takeaway options center around turkey with unique Asian flavors for savory dishes and chocolate-focused sweet treats. Source: Goodwood Park Hotel. item.title: Glory mooncakes are available in both traditional and novelty shapes
item.description:
Glory Food Products has unveiled its mid-autumn festival collection, featuring a variety of mooncakes in different sizes and shapes. The halal-certified collection includes individually packaged mini mooncakes in unique designs like bears, mice, cats, fish, the Ding Dang cartoon character, and the classic round form, ranging from S$0.50 to S$0.65.
